mentions.tacticalSituation: The fight here is between me and Brown's Labour candidate. The Conservatives cannot win in Bristol West.

issues.governance: I have been a vocal opponent of the Blair-Brown governments, for their attacks on our civil liberties and for the appalling handling of the nation's finances.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have had the privilege of being the Liberal Democrat MP for Bristol West since 2005. I believe that I have served the area well in the last five years.

politicalExperience.achievements: I was not implicated in the expenses scandal that rocked the political world in 2009. I only claim what is necessary to run one of the busiest MP offices in the country, dealing with over 5,000 constituents from local people every year.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Despite the Green Party doing well in the national polls, they no longer have any councillors in Bristol West. They came fourth in the 2009 council elections here, behind even the Green Party. At the last General Election, newspapers like the Daily Mail suggested that people who naturally support the Conservatives should support the Lib Dems in Bristol West. This is likely to be their advice again this time... and it worked in 2005!
